com.googlecode.cqengine.query

Interface ComparativeQuery<O,A>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - Type of objects in the collection
    A - Type of the attribute being examined by this query
    All Superinterfaces:
    Query<O>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LongestPrefix, Max, Min, SimpleComparativeQuery

    public interface ComparativeQuery<O,A>
extends Query<O>
    A special type of query which can only be evaluated by comparing objects stored in the collection with each other.

    It is not possible to determine if a certain object matches a comparative query in isolation; for example by calling matches(Object, QueryOptions). Therefore if that method is called on queries of this type, it will throw an exception. Comparative queries are instead evaluated via the method getMatches(ObjectSet, QueryOptions).

    Examples of comparative queries include QueryFactory.min(Attribute), QueryFactory.max(Attribute). It is only possible to determine the object(s) which have the minimum or maximum values of an attribute by examining all such attribute values throughout the collection (this may however be accelerated by an index). In this case, the objects are compared via the Comparable interface. The object(s) whose attribute values in the collection sort lower or higher (respectively) are the results of those queries.

    Note that comparative queries are not always implemented via the Comparable interface. For example, the LongestPrefix query examines the lengths of matched prefixes, rather than the relative ordering of objects in the collection as determined by Comparable. Therefore, this interface does not require that the generic type A extend Comparable per-se.

    • Method Detail

      • matches

        default boolean matches(O object,
                        QueryOptions queryOptions)
        Tests an object to see if it matches the assertion represented by the query.
        Specified by:
        matches in interface Query<O>
        Parameters:
        object - The object to test
        queryOptions - Optional parameters supplied by the application along with the operation which is causing this attribute to be invoked (either a query, or an update to the collection)
        Returns:
        True if the object matches the query, false if it does not
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - always

      • getMatches

        Iterable<O> getMatches(ObjectSet<O> objectsInCollection,
                       QueryOptions queryOptions)
        Evaluates the comparative query, returning the objects in the collection which match the query.
        Parameters:
        objectsInCollection - All objects in the collection
        queryOptions - Optional query options to use
        Returns:
        An iterator which provides the subset of objects in the collection which match the query
